wms_article.title: Korea‘s coffee bean imports top $721mn for first time in H1 on soaring prices

wms_article_body.body: South Korea’s coffee bean imports in the first half of 2025 topped 1 trillion won ($721 million) for the first time amid surging global prices. According to data from the Korea Agro-Fisheries Trade Corp. on Monday, imports of coffee beans, including roasted varieties, totaled 102,500 tons between January and June, up 5.4 percent from a year earlier. The import value, however, soared 53.9 percent to $866.2 million. The spike in value was largely due to a sharp rise in international coffee prices, particularly Arabica beans, which make up the bulk of Korea’s imports. Arabica prices climbed to $6,434 per ton as of July, up 23 percent from a year ago. With major producing regions facing extreme weather, concerns are growing that supply instability could drive prices even higher in the months ahead. The impact is already being felt by consumers. Retail coffee prices in June were up 12.4 percent year-on-year, according to Statistics Korea.
